content.prompt: Which of the following scenarios illustrates Washingtonâ€™s concerns?

choices.label: An increasing number of voters are not turning out to vote in elections.
Federalism can lead to different public policy outcomes between states.
Ideological divisions within Congress can lead to partisan gridlock.
Members of the press fail to report on the illegal activities of certain members of the bureaucracy.

skill.text: Skill 4.B: Explain how the argument or perspective in the source relates to political principles, institutions, processes, policies, and behaviors.
